history.proof: unfold reduces. exists f. intros x. shelve.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
f: BSM_PROBLEM -> MM_PROBLEM

Goal:
BSM_HALTING ⪯ MM_HALTING

Premises:
BSM_PROBLEM = {n : nat & {_ : nat & {_ : list (bsm_instr n) & vec (list bool) n}}} : Set
BSM_HALTING = fun P : BSM_PROBLEM => let (n, s) := P in let (i, s0) := s in let (P0, v) := s0 in (i, P0) /BSM/ (i, v) ↓ : BSM_PROBLEM -> Prop
MM_PROBLEM = {n : nat & {_ : list (mm_instr (pos n)) & vec nat n}} : Set
MM_HALTING = fun P : MM_PROBLEM => let (n, s) := P in let (P0, v) := s in sss_terminates (mm_sss (n:=n)) (1, P0) (1, v) : MM_PROBLEM -> Prop
reduces_transitive : forall (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop) (Y : Type) (Q : Y -> Prop) (Z : Type) (R : Z -> Prop), P ⪯ Q -> Q ⪯ R -> P ⪯ R
VectorDef.splitat : forall l r : nat, vec ?A (l + r) -> vec ?A l * vec ?A r where ?A : [f := fun H : BSM_PROBLEM => let (n, s) := H in let (i, s0) := s in let (P, v) := s0 in let s1 := bsm_mm_compiler_1 i P in let (Q, _) := s1 in existT (fun n0 : nat => {_ : list (mm_instr (pos n0)) & vec nat n0}) (2 + n) (existT (fun _ : list (mm_instr (pos (2 + n))) => vec nat (2 + n)) Q (0 ## 0 ## vec_map stack_enc v)) : BSM_PROBLEM -> MM_PROBLEM |- Type]
BSM_MM_HALTS_ON_ZERO = let f := fun H : BSM_PROBLEM => let (n, s) := H in let (i, s0) := s in let (P, v) := s0 in let s1 := bsm_mm_compiler_2 i P in let (Q, _) := s1 in existT (fun n0 : nat => {_ : list (mm_instr (pos n0)) & vec nat n0}) (2 + n) (existT (fun _ : list (mm_instr (pos (2 + n))) => vec nat (2 + n)) Q (0 ## 0 ## vec_map stack_enc v)) in ex_intro (fun f0 : BSM_PROBLEM -> MM_PROBLEM => reduction f0 BSM_HALTING MM_HALTS_ON_ZERO) f (fun x : BSM_PROBLEM => let (n, s) as s return (BSM_HALTING s <-> MM_HALTS_ON_ZERO (f s)) := x in let (i, s0) as s0 return (BSM_HALTING (existT (fun n0 : nat => {_ : nat & {_ : list (...
red_comp : forall (X : Type) (p : X -> Prop) (Y : Type) (q : Y -> Prop), p ⪯ q -> (fun x : X => ~ p x) ⪯ (fun y : Y => ~ q y)
MM_HALTS_ON_ZERO = fun P : MM_PROBLEM => let (n, s) := P in let (P0, v) := s in (1, P0) /MM/ (1, v) ~~> (0, vec_zero) : MM_PROBLEM -> Prop
pos_S_inv : forall p : pos (S ?n), (p = pos0) + {q : pos ?n | p = pos_nxt q} where ?n : [f := fun H : BSM_PROBLEM => let (n, s) := H in let (i, s0) := s in let (P, v) := s0 in let s1 := bsm_mm_compiler_1 i P in let (Q, _) := s1 in existT (fun n0 : nat => {_ : list (mm_instr (pos n0)) & vec nat n0}) (2 + n) (existT (fun _ : list (mm_instr (pos (2 + n))) => vec nat (2 + n)) Q (0 ## 0 ## vec_map stack_enc v)) : BSM_PROBLEM -> MM_PROBLEM |- nat]
reduces_reflexive : forall (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop), P ⪯ P
VectorDef.rectS : forall P : forall n : nat, vec ?A (S n) -> Type, (forall a : ?A, P 0 (a ## vec_nil)) -> (forall (a : ?A) (n : nat) (v : vec ?A (S n)), P n v -> P (S n) (a ## v)) ->...-> MM_PROBLEM |- Type]
reduces_dependent : forall (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop) (Y : Type) (Q : Y -> Prop), P ⪯ Q < -> inhabited (forall x : X, {y : Y | P x <-> Q y})
compiler_correction.instruction_compiler_sound : forall X Y : Set, ((nat -> nat) -> nat -> X -> list Y) -> forall state_X state_Y : Type, (X -> nat * state_X -> nat * state_X -> Prop) -> (Y -> nat * state_Y -> nat * state_Y -> Prop) -> (state_X -> state_Y -> Prop) -> Prop
compiler_correction.gen_compiler : forall X Y : Set, ((nat -> nat) -> nat -> X -> list Y) -> (X -> nat) -> nat * list X -> nat -> list Y
mm_pop : forall n : nat, pos n -> pos n -> pos n -> nat -> nat -> nat -> nat -> list (mm_instr (pos n))
Inductive ascii : Set := Ascii : bool -> bool -> bool -> bool -> bool -> bool -> bool -> bool -> Ascii.ascii Arguments Ascii.Ascii (_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _)%bool_scope
compiler.linker : forall X : Type, (X -> nat) -> nat * list X -> nat -> nat -> nat -> nat
compiler_correction.gen_linker : forall X : Set, (X -> nat) -> nat * list X -> nat -> nat -> nat
sss_compute : forall (instr : Set) (data : Type), (instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop) -> nat * list instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop
sss_output : forall (instr : Set) (data : Type), (instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop) -> nat * list instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop
sss_progress : forall (instr : Set) (data : Type), (instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop) -> nat * list instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop
sss_step : forall (instr : Set) (data : Type), (instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop) -> nat * list instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop
Inductive ZArithProof : Type := DoneProof : ZMicromega.ZArithProof | RatProof : ZMicromega.ZWitness -> ZMicromega.ZArithProof -> ZMicromega.ZArithProof | CutProof : ZMicromega.ZWitness -> ZMicromega.ZArithProof -> ZMicromega.ZArithProof | EnumProof : ZMicromega.ZWitness -> ZMicromega.ZWitness -> list ZMicromega.ZArithProof -> ZMicromega.ZArithProof | ExProof : BinNums.positive -> ZMicromega.ZArithProof -> ZMicromega.ZArithProof Arguments ZMicromega.EnumProof _ _ _%list_scope Arguments ZMicromega.ExProof _%positive_scope
sss_step_stall : forall (instr : Set) (data : Type), (instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop) -> nat * list instr -> nat * data -> Prop
sss_terminates : forall (instr : Set) (data : Type), (instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop) -> nat * list instr -> nat * data -> Prop
reduction = fun (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (P : X -> Prop) (Q : Y -> Prop) => forall x : X, P x < -> Q (f x) : forall X Y : Type, (X -> Y) -> (X -> Prop) -> (Y -> Prop) -> Prop Arguments reduction {X Y}%type_scope (_ _ _)%function_scope
compiler_correction.gen_compiler_terminates : forall (X Y : Set) (icomp : (nat -> nat) -> nat -> X -> list Y) (ilen : X -> nat), (forall (lnk : nat -> nat) (n : nat) (x : X), length (icomp lnk n x) = ilen x) -> forall (state_X state_Y : Type) (step_X : X -> nat * state_X -> nat * state_X -> Prop) (step_Y : Y -> nat * state_Y -> nat * state_Y -> Prop), (forall (I : X) (st1 : nat * state_X), exists st2 : nat * state_X, step_X I st1 st2) -> (forall (I : Y) (st st1 st2 : nat * state_Y), step_Y I st st1 -> step_Y I st st2 -> st1 = st2) -> forall simul : state_X -> state_Y -> Prop, compiler_correction.instruction_compiler_sound icomp step_X step_Y simul ->...-> sss_terminates step_X (fst P, snd P) (fst P, v)
compiler_correction.gen_compiler_complete : forall (X Y : Set) (icomp : (nat -> nat) -> nat -> X -> list Y) (ilen : X -> nat), (forall (lnk : nat -> nat) (n : nat) (x : X), length (icomp lnk n x) = ilen x) -> forall (state_X state_Y : Type) (step_X : X -> nat * state_X -> nat * state_X -> Prop) (step_Y : Y -> nat * state_Y -> nat * state_Y -> Prop), (forall (I : X) (st1 : nat * state_X), exists st2 : nat * state_X, step_X I st1 st2) -> (forall (I : Y) (st st1 st2 : nat * state_Y), step_Y I st st1 -> step_Y I st st2 -> st1 = st2) -> forall simul : state_X -> state_Y -> Prop, compiler_correction.instruction_compiler_sound icomp step_X step_Y simul ->...-> sss_terminates step_X (fst P, snd P) (i1, v1)
compiler_correction.compiler_complete : forall (X Y : Set) (icomp : (nat -> nat) -> nat -> X -> list Y) (ilen : X -> nat), (forall (lnk : nat -> nat) (n : nat) (x : X), length (icomp lnk n x) = ilen x) -> forall (state_X state_Y : Type) (step_X : X -> nat * state_X -> nat * state_X -> Prop) (step_Y : Y -> nat * state_Y -> nat * state_Y -> Prop), (forall (I : X) (st1 : nat * state_X), exists st2 : nat * state_X, step_X I st1 st2) -> (forall (I : Y) (st st1 st2 : nat * state_Y), step_Y I st st1 -> step_Y I st st2 -> st1 = st2) -> forall simul : state_X -> state_Y -> Prop, compiler_correction.instruction_compiler_sound icomp step_X step_Y simul ->...-> sss_terminates step_X P (i1, v1)
reduces = fun (X Y : Type) (P : X -> Prop) (Q : Y -> Prop) => exists f : X -> Y, reduction f P Q : forall X Y : Type, (X -> Prop) -> (Y -> Prop) -> Prop Arguments reduces {X Y}%type_scope (_ _)%function_scope
mm_push_One : forall n : nat, pos n -> pos n -> pos n -> nat -> list (mm_instr (pos n))
mm_push_Zero : forall n : nat, pos n -> pos n -> pos n -> nat -> list (mm_instr (pos n))
mm_transfert : forall n : nat, pos n -> pos n -> pos n -> nat -> list (mm_instr (pos n))
mm_div2 : forall n : nat, pos n -> pos n -> pos n -> nat -> list (mm_instr (pos n))
mm_mul2 : forall n : nat, pos n -> pos n -> pos n -> nat -> list (mm_instr (pos n))
bsm_instr_compile : forall m : nat, (nat -> nat) -> nat -> bsm_instr m -> list (mm_instr (pos (2 + m)))
compiler_correction.compiler_complete_step : forall (X Y : Set) (icomp : (nat -> nat) -> nat -> X -> list Y) (ilen : X -> nat), (forall (lnk : nat -> nat) (n : nat) (x : X), length (icomp lnk n x) = ilen x) -> forall (state_X state_Y : Type) (step_X : X -> nat * state_X -> nat * state_X -> Prop) (step_Y : Y -> nat * state_Y -> nat * state_Y -> Prop), (forall (I : X) (st1 : nat * state_X), exists st2 : nat * state_X, step_X I st1 st2) ->...-> exists (q : nat) (st2 : nat * state_X) (w2 : nat * state_Y), simul (snd st2) (snd w2) /\ linker (fst st2) = fst w2 /\ sss_compute step_X P st1 st2 /\ sss_steps step_Y Q q w2 w3 /\ q < p
VarMap.find : forall A : Type, A -> VarMap.t A -> BinNums.positive -> A
compiler.length_compiler : forall X : Type, (X -> nat) -> list X -> nat
ZifyClasses.mkapp2 : forall (S1 S2 S3 T : Type) (Op : S1 -> S2 -> S3) (I1 : S1 -> T) (I2 : S2 -> T) (I3 : S3 -> T) (TBOP : T -> T -> T), (forall (n : S1) (m : S2), I3 (Op n m) = TBOP (I1 n) (I2 m)) -> forall (s1 : S1) (t1 : T), I1 s1 = t1 -> forall (s2 : S2) (t2 : T), I2 s2 = t2 -> I3 (Op s1 s2) = TBOP t1 t2
Inductive PExpr (C : Type) : Type := PEc : C -> EnvRing.PExpr C | PEX : BinNums.positive -> EnvRing.PExpr C | PEadd : EnvRing.PExpr C -> EnvRing.PExpr C -> EnvRing.PExpr C | PEsub : EnvRing.PExpr C -> EnvRing.PExpr C -> EnvRing.PExpr C | PEmul : EnvRing.PExpr C -> EnvRing.PExpr C -> EnvRing.PExpr C | PEopp : EnvRing.PExpr C -> EnvRing.PExpr C | PEpow : EnvRing.PExpr C -> BinNums.N -> EnvRing.PExpr C Arguments EnvRing.PExpr _%type_scope Arguments EnvRing.PEc {C}%type_scope Arguments EnvRing.PEX {C}%type_scope _%positive_scope Arguments EnvRing.PEadd {C}%type_scope Arguments EnvRing.PEsub {C}%type_scope Arguments EnvRing.PEmul {C}%type_scope Arguments EnvRing.PEopp {C}%type_scope Arguments EnvRing.PEpow {C}%type_scope _ _%N_scope
POP : forall n : nat, pos n -> nat -> nat -> bsm_instr n
mm_comp.lnk : forall m : nat, nat -> list (bsm_instr m) -> nat -> nat

``` 
unfold reduces. exists f. intros x. unfold BSM_HALTING, MM_HALTING, BSM_MM_HALTS_ON_ZERO, bsm_mm_compiler_1, bsm_mm_compiler_2. split; intro H; destruct x as [(n, s) [i [P v]]]; destruct s as [i s0]; destruct s0 as [P0 v].
- apply H.
- apply H.
```
